DataElement.preferredName: Abdominal Cavity Thoracic Cavity Body Ascites Pleural Effusion Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether fluid, ascites or pleural effusion, is present in the third space, abdominal cavity or thoracic cavity.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Abdominal Cavity Thoracic Cavity Body Ascites Pleural Effusion Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity or pleural cavity being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (AB-do-men) The area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs.:The cavity in the vertebrate body enclosed by the ribs between the diaphragm and the neck and containing the lungs and heart.:The entire physical structure of an organism.  It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Concepts.definition: The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
The cavity in the vertebrate body enclosed by the ribs between the diaphragm and the neck and containing the lungs and heart.
The entire physical structure of an organism. It is composed of anatomic systems, regions, cavities, and spaces.

Property.preferredDefinition: Accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity.  The fluid may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum. -- 2004:Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity containing no malignant cells:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: The accumulation of fluid in the peritoneal cavity, which may be serous, hemorrhagic, or the result of tumor metastasis to the peritoneum.

Increased amounts of fluid within the pleural cavity. Symptoms include shortness of breath, cough, and chest pain. It is usually caused by lung infections, congestive heart failure, pleural and lung tumors, connective tissue disorders, and trauma.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.
